TITLE: Even amid inflation and recession worries, there are opportunities to build wealth, top-ranked advisors say
SUMMARY: CNBC FA 100 ranked advisors say they don't know exactly how today's uncertainties will shake out. But there are definite reasons for optimism and opportunities.

TITLE: Delaying big purchases, reducing debt: 76% of adults are making lifestyle changes to prepare for a potential recession
SUMMARY: Amid persisting high inflation and fears of a recession, most adults are adjusting their financial decisions, new research shows.

TITLE: 'Black Friday is here': Holiday sales are already on, with record-breaking deals
SUMMARY: Holiday sales are starting earlier this year as retailers try to unload excess inventory and entice shoppers worried about inflation.

TITLE: What we know so far about the student loan forgiveness application coming soon from the Education Department
SUMMARY: The student loan forgiveness application shouldn't require borrowers to attach any documentation, but they will need to provide their Social Security number.

TITLE: Here's the inflation breakdown for September 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Inflation was hotter than expected in September. Categories such as food, energy and housing have risen sharply in the past year.

TITLE: Social Security cost-of-living adjustment will be 8.7% in 2023, highest increase in 40 years
SUMMARY: High inflation will prompt a record Social Security cost-of-living increase in 2023. Here's what that means for benefits.

TITLE: Young, wealthy investors are flocking to alternative investments, study shows. What to know before adding to your portfolio
SUMMARY: Many younger, wealthy investors are looking beyond the stock market for above-average returns, with 80% turning to alternative investments.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot is now $420 million and Mega Millions' top prize is $494 million. Here's how to handle a huge windfall
SUMMARY: If you beat the odds stacked against hitting the jackpot, there are some key things to do — and not do — right out of the gate.

TITLE: Missed a tax credit from last year? You can claim that money through Nov. 15
SUMMARY: GetCTC.org will let those who typically don't file tax returns claim the child tax and earned income tax credits and third stimulus checks, through Nov. 15.

TITLE: These colleges promise no student debt: 'Loans are not part of the deal'
SUMMARY: To make college more accessible, a growing number of institutions are eliminating student loans from their financial aid packages.

TITLE: How to make inflation-protected bonds work in your portfolio as interest rates rise
SUMMARY: Despite recent losses, Treasury inflation-protected securities, or TIPS, offer portfolio diversification amid market uncertainty, experts say.

TITLE: Free weekly credit reports are available through the end of 2023. Why you may want to check yours now
SUMMARY: Free weekly credit reports are now available from the three major credit bureaus through the end of 2023. Here's how that can help boost your credit score.

TITLE: Here’s what a new Biden administration labor proposal would mean for independent contractors
SUMMARY: The Labor Department is poised to propose a regulation with new guidelines for employers to determine whether workers are employees or contractors.

TITLE: Amazon's 'Prime Early Access Sale' is on — here are the best deals to shop now
SUMMARY: The early holiday deals have begun. Here's a look at some of the best deals being offered now.

TITLE: Here's how to avoid buying a flood-damaged car following Hurricane Ian
SUMMARY: While not all of these vehicles will end up for sale, buyers should be on guard against purchasing a used car that has damage from flooding.

TITLE: The best year-end tax strategies from top-ranked advisors – including a 'once in a multiple-decade opportunity'
SUMMARY: These are some of the best year-end tax strategies, according to advisors from CNBC's 2022 FA 100 list.

TITLE: These are common (and costly) Roth IRA conversion mistakes. Here's how to avoid them
SUMMARY: While Roth individual retirement account conversions may be alluring when the stock market dips, it's easy to make mistakes, financial experts say.

TITLE: Here's why more than 7 million student loan borrowers could miss out on federal forgiveness program
SUMMARY: Consumer advocates say that requiring student loan borrowers to apply for forgiveness will lead to many people missing out on the relief.

TITLE: Congress is still considering changes to the retirement system, including catch-up contributions
SUMMARY: If lawmakers don't act before the end of the year, the legislative process for improving the retirement system would have to start again in a new Congress.

TITLE: Here's how uber-rich pass wealth to heirs tax-free when markets are down
SUMMARY: Wealthy people like Michael Bloomberg and Mark Zuckerberg have used grantor-retained annuity trusts. The trusts have better odds of success in down markets.

TITLE: Social Security's cost-of-living increase for 2023 would be largest in 40 years. Here's what that means for benefits
SUMMARY: Social Security beneficiaries who are struggling with high prices may get welcome news when the cost-of-living adjustment for 2023 is announced.

TITLE: IRS delays guidelines, waiving penalties for some inherited retirement accounts until 2023
SUMMARY: If you inherited a retirement account in 2020 or 2021, the IRS is waiving penalties for some heirs who needed to start taking required minimum distributions.

TITLE: 'Life is getting more expensive by the day.' Amid inflation, 32% of Americans are struggling to pay their bills
SUMMARY: The rising cost of living is weighing on consumers, causing more to fall behind on their monthly bills.

TITLE: Here's how to pay 0% capital gains taxes with a six-figure income
SUMMARY: You may qualify for the 0% long-term capital gains rate with a six-figure income. Here's how to calculate your taxable income to harvest tax-free gains.

TITLE: There's new optimism the $300 monthly child tax credit checks can be renewed — but the relief may look different
SUMMARY: There's new hope the monthly child tax credit payments of up to $300 per month can be renewed. Here's how those checks may be different.

TITLE: Long-term unemployment dips by another 70,000 people. Here's what that means for job seekers
SUMMARY: The ranks of people who are unemployed for at least six months continue to decline in a strong labor market for job seekers.

TITLE: Biden's student loan forgiveness application will go live any day now. Here's how to prepare
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education has said the application for student loan forgiveness will be live in early October, suggesting it could be ready any day now.

TITLE: These are the 10 states where renters are most behind on payments — and high-cost California didn't make the list
SUMMARY: Some 15% of American households, around 6 million, are behind on rent this fall, according to a new report. Here's where renters are struggling the most.

TITLE: Medicare's annual fall enrollment period starts Oct. 15. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: The annual window for making changes to your Advantage Plan or prescription drug coverage starts Oct. 15, with choices taking effect Jan. 1.

TITLE: As California stimulus checks of up to $1,050 start to go out, here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: As many as 23 million Californians will benefit from a record-high state surplus when they receive direct payments starting this month.
